title_sort: louisa van velsor whitman to walt whitman, 17 october [1867]
title: Louisa Van Velsor Whitman to Walt Whitman, 17 October [1867]
text: Oct 17th My dear Walt1867the post man has gone byeby and no letters, and its being thursdayThursday i feel worried very much for fear it is gone as i didentdidn't get it yesterday my usuallusual day i thought i would get it to daytoday i wanted very much to hear from you and likewise i was very short of money but if you have sent it it is taken sure i think of every thing that is unlikely to happen O walt if you are sick or any thing the matter i hope you will let me know immedtelyimmediately as i shall be very uneasy till i hear i wrote A letter last week to you walter i suppose you got it it is too bad if the letter is gone i have been wachingwaching the letter man and he she's past and no letter i feel real bad my lameness is not much better yet i am taking medicine from a doctor a very good one i think the one matty had for sis he has great practice and has a very good name he said if this didentdidn't help me he didentdidn't know as any thing would but he thought this wouldgood bie Walter dearmatt dontdon't hear from Jeff very often they are here yet Louisa Van Velsor Whitman to Walt Whitman, 17 October [1867]
